hints.title: Discrete Translation Equivariance
hints.content:
901: :label: thm-discrete-translation-equivariance-rigorous
902: 
903: If the reward function $R: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}$ is translation-invariant:
904: 
905: $$
906: R(x + a) = R(x) \quad \forall x \in \mathcal{X}, a \in \mathbb{R}^d
907: $$
908: 
909: then the Fractal Set distribution is **translation-equivariant**:
910: 
911: $$
912: \mathcal{L}(\mathcal{F}) = \mathcal{L}(T_a(\mathcal{F}))
913: $$
914: 
915: where $T_a(\mathcal{F})$ translates all episode positions by $a$.

hints.title: Discrete-Continuous Symmetry Correspondence
hints.content:
923: :label: prop-symmetry-correspondence-rigorous
924: 
925: The following table establishes the correspondence between **discrete symmetries** of the Fractal Set and **continuous symmetries** of the emergent continuum theory:
926: 
927: | **Discrete (Fractal Set)** | **Continuous (Continuum Limit)** | **Physical Meaning** |
928: |----------------------------|----------------------------------|----------------------|
929: | Episode relabeling $S_{|\mathcal{E}|}$ | Particle permutation $S_N$ / Braid group $B_N$ | Walker indistinguishability |
930: | CST temporal ordering | Time translation $\mathbb{R}$ | Causality |
931: | IG spatial coupling | Diffeomorphisms Diff($\mathcal{X}$) | Coordinate freedom |
932: | Reward shift $R \to R + c$ | Global U(1)_fitness phase | Fitness scale invariance |
933: | Episode pair $(i, j)$ exchange | SU(2)_weak isospin rotation | Cloning role exchange |
934: 
935: **Key insight:** Discrete symmetries are **exact** on the Fractal Set, while continuous symmetries are **emergent** in the $N \to \infty$ limit.
